pull.title: utils: Convert fs::filesystem_error messages from local multibyte to utf-8 on Windows

events.message: utils: Convert fs error messages from multibyte to utf-8

issue.title: Filename and command line encoding issue on Windows
issue.body:
This issue tracks the TODO list in order to fix the encoding issue on Window.

Currently Bitcoin Core uses the ANSI encoding on Windows so that it would affected by user's language settings, they might not able to open some non-ASCII name files.

You can test all these changes in #13787 (includes leveldb changes)

Open PRs:
------------
- [ ] Package the Windows installer in unicode mode (NSIS 3+) (#13827, Up for grab, or wait for Ubuntu 20.04 gitian builder host)

Merged PRs:
--------------
- [x] Create the startup shortcut file in unicode mode (#13734)
- [x] Make filelock work on unicode filename (#13862)
- [x] Use `_wfopen` instead of `fopen` on Windows to pass unicode filename (#13866)
- [x] Make boost `fs::path` `.string()` to be always encoded to utf-8 (#13877)
- [x] Wrap `ifstream` and `ofstream` to accept unicode filename. (#13878)
- [x] Get the command line arguments using unicode (#13883)
- [x] Make bdb read the filename using utf-8 (#13884)
- [x] Make `runCommand` works on unicode filename (#13886)
- [x] Convert all `(...)A` function to `(...)W` on Windows if it is related to filename or command line. (#13888)
- [x] Convert boost filesystem error messages from local multibyte to utf-8 (#14192)
- [x] Make leveldb read the filename using utf-8 (bitcoin-core/leveldb#18)

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #13878 (utils: Add fstream wrapper to allow to pass unicode filename on Windows by ken2812221)
* #13787 (Test for Windows encoding issue by ken2812221)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: utils: Add fstream wrapper to allow to pass unicode filename on Windows
issue.body:
If compiled with mingw, use glibc++ extension `stdio_filebuf` to open the file by `FILE*` instead of filename.

In other condition, we can use boost::fstream.

issue.title: Test for Windows encoding issue
issue.body: This PR removes unused Windows compatible path. Encoding issues has been solved.

issue.title: tests: Run functional test on Windows and enable it on Appveyor
issue.body:
This PR do the following things:
- Make functional tests compatible with Windows
- Print color output in functional tests for Windows 10
- Run util and functional tests on appveyor
- Do not run symlink tests on Windows

Note:
- The wallet_multiwallet.py fail is unrelated to the test framework, it's a bug related to c++ code or maybe dependencies. `bitcoind` would exit with 0xC0000005(Access violation) during shutdown occasionally. Disable this for now.
- Not using `--failfast` because this is still in experimental. We should track if there is any other error.
- Disable ZMQ tests because the python zmq library could cause access violation sometimes.
- Disable `feature_notifications` because Bitcoin Core handles the command in different thread, whicha can cause a race condition.

issue.title: Merge #19660, #19373, #19841, #13862, #13866, #17280, #17682 and partial #19326, #14978: Auxiliary Backports
issue.body:
## Overview

As part of https://github.com/dashpay/dash/pull/4025, component pull requests that are required by TorV3 logic are being broken down into branches wherever feasable. In anticipation of the merger of https://github.com/dashpay/dash/pull/4028, the preparation for the next round of dependencies for TorV3 (excluding https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19687/commits/2bc207190e6f1818b04c9336f6e0d625b2a2a0ba, relies on #4028) 

## Contents

* Mostly merged bitcoin#19660: ("refactor: Make HexStr take a span" by laanwj)
  * See https://github.com/UdjinM6/dash/commit/6f7b52ac63a71d2706022ca58d69a1a622e0fa37, requires bitcoin#13557, reworded as "partial" though could be treated as merged
* Merge bitcoin#19373: ("refactor: Replace HexStr(o.begin(), o.end()) with HexStr(o)" by laanwj)
* Merge bitcoin#19841: ("Implement Keccak and SHA3_256" by sipa)
* Merge bitcoin#13862: ("utils: drop boost::interprocess::file_lock" by ken2812221) 
* Merge bitcoin#13866 ("utils: Use _wfopen and _wfreopen on Windows" by ken2812221) 
* Merge https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17280 ("refactor: Change occurences of c_str() used with size() to data()" by laanwj)
  * Small nit, it also modifies `get_filesystem_error_message` (added in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14192 that relies on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14209, which in turn relies on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12954) that hasn't been implemented so that change was omitted

### Partials

* Merge #19326 ("Simplify hash.h interface using Spans" by sipa)
  * Excludes 2a2182c387f607cd8284f33890bd285a81077b7f, 02c4cc5c5ddf61f98ee366a4bea8abc26de492bd. Blocked by https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17938
* Merge #14978 ("Factor out PSBT utilities from RPCs for use in GUI code; related refactoring" by gwillen)
  * Only contains 162ffefd2f562169725559906601c25c579aa91c to resolve merge conflict in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19687
## Disclosures

* Dash-specific changes may not have been tested, only compilation and successful tests has been ensured. Running the client on (a) testnet(s) may be necessary.
* Contains squashed patches 85ce71d759e2e3aa296e09ac3754914eaf230423, 6f7b52ac63a71d2706022ca58d69a1a622e0fa37, f6cf5478601048e9b681622eff7c8353be80866d and e39a095530af569590eeafbd903135151026990f by UdjinM6

issue.title: Solve filename and command line encoding issues on Windows
issue.body:
As the software is currently using the ANSI encoding on Windows, the user's language settings could affect the proper functioning of the node/wallet, to the point of not be able to open some non-ASCII name files and directories.

This solves the Windows encoding issues, completing the entire #13869 work path (and some other required backports). Enabling for example users that use non-english characters in directories and file names to be accepted.

Backported PRs:
* #12422.
* #12630.
* #13862.
* #13866.
* #13877.
* #13878.
* #13883.
* #13884.
* #13886.
* #13888.
* #14192.
* #13734.
* #14426.

This is built on top of other two PRs that i have open #2423 and #2369.
Solves old issues #940 and #2163.


TODO:
* Backport `assert_start_raises_init_error` and `ErrorMatch` in TestNode` (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12718)
